059bc1b0-d479-4e21-a335-a36e175c464a.name: 4 - A total of -20 points from the following Disadvantages:

870045db-da9e-49a5-90d5-358b192c0b45.name: Impulsiveness
870045db-da9e-49a5-90d5-358b192c0b45.notes: Make a self-control roll whenever it would be wise to wait and ponder. If you fail, you must act

20bf252c-c239-41d2-a0b4-801b992d3cd3.name: Odious Personal Habit: Can't stay still

8e36044e-b897-4e63-b32e-6afaab513820.name: Overconfidence
8e36044e-b897-4e63-b32e-6afaab513820.notes: You must make a self-control roll any time the GM feels you show an unreasonable degree of caution. If you fail, you must go ahead as though you were able to handle the situation!

features.situation: from young or naive individuals who believe you are as good as you say you are
from others where conversation is required

44019c14-296b-4c6a-8dde-57064d179659.name: Trickster
44019c14-296b-4c6a-8dde-57064d179659.notes: Make a self-control roll each day. If you fail, you must try to trick a dangerous subject: a skilled warrior, a dangerous monster, a whole group of reasonably competent opponents, etc. If you resist, you get a cumulative -1 per day to your self-control roll until you finally fail a roll!

a513d884-7e83-4be7-a201-10860edc5f71.text: 500 points - The theme of your powers is superhuman speed. This contrasts with the Acrobat (p. 41), whose milieu is agility and coordination – but the two can profitably be combined.
